dies have shown that a diet high in lycopene may be linked to a decreased risk of prostate cancer, but other studies have not. It has not been proven that taking lycopene supplements decreases the risk of prostate cancer.
                
                
                    Cancer prevention clinical trials are used to study ways to prevent cancer.
